comment: She gives too much unnecessary work.  She does not have a clear syllabus, it's extremely hard to understand and she does not explain anything accurately.  DO NOT TAKE HER!!!!!!!! During the summer , she expected 16-weeks course work completed in 4-weeks. I paid for the course; however, I did not learn too much from it. She is very unconcerned!
Shes an okay teacher be for lab assignments every week. I only wish she was more hands on half the time it was her reading off a PowerPoint but other then that she's good

This class was extremely work heavy and there were MULTIPLE of relatively easy (but VERY time consuming) assignments due on the same day. The syllabus is unreliable and confusing for knowing when certain assignments were due. Grades assignments SUPER last minute. Uses external course website that you must pay $80+ for to complete your assignments.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I wouldn't recommend taking this class over the summer. Her instructions are vague and she grades extremely hard but doesn't provide examples of how she wants the assignments done the workload was insane and it seems like the workload for the course was not modified to consider the fact that the summer semester is half as long as fall or spring.

TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR IF YOU CAN! She's okay AT BEST, clearly has favorites, and claims to be "lecture heavy" but she sits there reading off half-assed PowerPoints expecting us to read her mind and know what to do. She thinks she's accessible outside of class but she's not, she's lying. Doesn't work with students with assignments or questions.

She already started the semester rough with her surgery delaying the class. Then had everything due the day she came back and didn't send emails out to let us know. does NOT engage with the class and just SITS THERE and expects us to magically know the information. Not accessible after class. take someone else fr
Lovely and passionate professor. She is very approachable and has good office hours. We did a literature review and she gave great feedback. Overall great professors.

She couldve been WAYY better. If you see a better professor go there. Amanda's really good. Attitude and antics took away from the class. Has favorite students and will let them turn in a quiz late or resubmit an assignment. Not willing to help if you have bad internet or wifi. Doesn't empathize and doesnt work with her students that well tbh
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: She was very helpful and open to emailing or meeting outsude of class for any help. You can literally ask her any question and she will do her best to make sure you understand. COME TO CLASS or else you will not understand assignments completely.

Dr. Wright is amazing. She is a very interactive, helpful, and engaging. Weekly assignments, but everything is well explained and reasonable. Looking forward to taking another class with her next semester.

I've taken her twice. This semester, she showed a lot of unprofessional actions. She neglected to follow proper guidelines for the course disciplinary actions and accused the student of something that did not happen. She failed to communicate with student many times. This escalated and she was placed under review by her supervisor. I was displeased
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I took Dr. Wright for PHE 2400. She is probably one of the most genuine and kind people I've ever met & runs her classroom in a way that shows it. She is a great lecturer and explains things in a way that make sense with lots of examples. Weekly assignments have you apply the week's theory to your specific public health interests. Very caring!!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Wright is a new professor at KSU and I absolutely love her. She is so kind, genuine, and super personable. She is super passionate about her work which I admire. The class was mostly a group project where we learned how to create a program hands on instead of listening to lectures and taking tests. I learned so much from her. Take her classes!!
